Sentencas: Strontium titanate, a perovskite oxide, is a frequently studied material for a large variety of applications.
Titulo: Grain boundary segregation in iron doped strontium titanate: From dilute to concentrated solid solutions

Sentencas: When acceptor-doped (with Fe, for example), the material is useful for its mixed oxygen and electronic conductivity, with potential use in oxygen transport membranes or as a cathode for solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Grain boundary segregation in iron doped strontium titanate: From dilute to concentrated solid solutions

Sentencas: A barrier to conductivity in perovskites is the presence of space charge regions at the grain boundaries, which form due to the segregation of charged point defects.
Titulo: Grain boundary segregation in iron doped strontium titanate: From dilute to concentrated solid solutions

Sentencas: Typically, space charge theory assumes bulk dopant concentrations beneath the dilute limit, however concentrated solid-solutions are often utilized in applications.
Titulo: Grain boundary segregation in iron doped strontium titanate: From dilute to concentrated solid solutions

Sentencas: The current work aims to address this disparity: grain boundary segregation in strontium ferrite-strontium titanate solid-solutions is analyzed at three compositions, with Fe contents ranging from near the dilute limit to well above the dilute limit (Fe contents of 2 %, 5 %, and 25 % on the B-site of the perovskite).
Titulo: Grain boundary segregation in iron doped strontium titanate: From dilute to concentrated solid solutions

Sentencas: Electrochemical impedance spectroscopy shows an increase in material conductivity as Fe is added.
Titulo: Grain boundary segregation in iron doped strontium titanate: From dilute to concentrated solid solutions

Sentencas: High-resolution STEM imaging and spectral mapping is utilized, showing that Fe segregates to the grain boundary core, contrary to what is expected from space charge theory.
Titulo: Grain boundary segregation in iron doped strontium titanate: From dilute to concentrated solid solutions

Sentencas: As the Fe content is increased, the amount of Fe segregated to the boundary increases significantly, but the segregation width of Fe at the boundary remains consistent.
Titulo: Grain boundary segregation in iron doped strontium titanate: From dilute to concentrated solid solutions
